clinical_study.brief_title: Urinary Disorders in Subacute Patients After Stroke
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment and Treatment of Urinary Disorders in Patients in the Subacute Phase After Stroke

lead_sponsor.agency: University Rehabilitation Institute, Republic of Slovenia

clinical_study.source: University Rehabilitation Institute, Republic of Slovenia

brief_summary.textblock: This observational study will address urinary disorders in subacute stroke patients. Patients without and with urinary disorders will be compared, and treatment outcome will be assessed among the latter.

detailed_description.textblock: This prospective observational study will include 100 patients after first ischaemic or hemorrhagic stroke directly transferred from an acute hospital to our Institute for inpatient rehabilitation. Within admission assessment, patients will be classified according to stroke type, stroke localisation and time since stroke. Comorbidities will be recorded and associated neurological deficits will be assessed. Post mictional residue will be determined in all patients one day after admission. The patients with urinary disorders will be treated according to the published official protocol, either using the immediate urination approach or the bladder diary approach. Continence will be regularly assessed by the nursing staff. Urination-disorder-related complications (pressure ulcers, falls and urinary infections), drug therapy and the use of continence aids will also be followed.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, for an average of 6 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Urinary continence will be assessed daily by the nursing staff as either complete, partial or incontinence

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, for an average of 6 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Pressure ulcers, falls and urinary infections caused by urinary disorders will be recorded

arm_group.description: Subacute stroke patients without urinary disorders
Subacute stroke patients with urinary disorders

intervention.description: Patients with decreased cognitive ability will be taught to immediately go to the toilet upon feeling the urge to urinate and to be independent in urinating.
Patients with normal cognitive abilities will be instructed to go to the toilet every 2-3 hours regardless of the urge to urinate

study_pop.textblock: Subacute patients after ischaemic or hemorrhagic stroke directly transferred from an acute hospital to complex inpatient rehabilitation
